---
title: "Optimisation déterministe (MILP) — Exemple"
---

## Problème
Déterminer une décision optimale sous contraintes (capacités, flux, coûts). Objectif : minimiser le coût total.

## Modèle (extrait)
On cherche :
$\min \sum_{i,j} c_{ij} x_{ij}$  
sous contraintes :
$\sum_j x_{ij} = 1 \ \forall i$

## Démo (Python)
```{python}
import pulp

# mini affectation
I = ["A","B","C"]
J = ["L1","L2","L3"]
c = {("A","L1"):3,("A","L2"):2,("A","L3"):4,
     ("B","L1"):2,("B","L2"):5,("B","L3"):1,
     ("C","L1"):4,("C","L2"):1,("C","L3"):3}

m = pulp.LpProblem("assign", pulp.LpMinimize)
x = pulp.LpVariable.dicts("x", (I,J), 0, 1, cat="Binary")

m += pulp.lpSum(c[(i,j)]*x[i][j] for i in I for j in J)
for i in I:
    m += pulp.lpSum(x[i][j] for j in J) == 1
for j in J:
    m += pulp.lpSum(x[i][j] for i in I) <= 1

m.solve(pulp.PULP_CBC_CMD(msg=False))
{(i,j): pulp.value(x[i][j]) for i in I for j in J if pulp.value(x[i][j]) > 0.5}
